page.title: 09POTTERY,WENFORD BRIDGE
page.content: THE POTTERY IS ABOUT 200 YEARS OLD. AT ONE TIME IT USED TO BE AN INN CALLED THE WENFORD INN AND WAS SUPPLIED BY THE ST. AUSTELL BREWERY. IN 1957 THERE WAS A FLOOD WHICH RUINED THE WHOLE AREA,THE TABLE INSIDE THE HOUSE WAS FLOATING IN ALL THE WATER YOU CAN STILL SEE THE MARK ON THE TABLE MADE BY THE WATER. PART OF THE BUILDING WAS BURNT DOWN AND REBUILT IN 1963 AND YOU CAN STILL SEE THE BLACKSMITHS DEPARTMENT.THERE USED TO BE A SKITTLE ALLY THERE WHEN IT WAS A BREW HOUSE (WE DO NOT KNOW WHO OWNED IT). THERE WAS A COAL TRAIN THAT PASSED THE POTTERY ONCE A DAY AT LUNCH TIME AND ENDED AT LOWER LANK. THERE WAS ALSO A MOTORIZED TRAIN RUNNING THROUGH DELANK QUARRY WHICH IS NEAR THE POTTERY.
